document_title: Blood in the urine (hematuria): Causes, symptoms and diagnosis
subsection_content:
Blood in the urine is a common symptom of urinary diseases. Symptoms affect nearly 30% of the US adult population in 2022.
The most obvious clinical sign of gross hematuria is light pink or red urine. However, blood mixed with urine does not cause pain to the patient. If the patient has pain in the pelvis, lower abdomen or waist at the same time as symptoms of hematuria, these are other symptoms of kidney and bladder disease. At this time, the patient needs to go to the hospital to be examined by a specialist as soon as possible.
Patients should note that because blood in the urine is a symptom of urinary disease, it often appears along with other clinical signs such as nausea, vomiting, fever, chills and pain in the abdomen or back. below.
For microscopic hematuria, the patient will have no signs to recognize the disease until a urine test is performed. However, patients may suspect that they have microscopic hematuria when the above symptoms appear.
